other_tests.findings: The liver is diffusely echogenic, consistent with fatty infiltration. There are areas of focal fat sparing, particularly around the gallbladder fossa. The contour of the liver is smooth. There is no focal liver mass. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites. There is a large amount of echogenic sludge within the slightly distended gallbladder. Gallbladder wall is thickened measuring up to 7 mm. No pericholecystic fluid.
